page.title: 14FLOWER FESTIVAL (1985)
page.content: A Flower Festival was held in June '85 in aid of St. Giles Church. The Church was open to visitors throughout the weekend. A service was held on Friday Evening , a Choral Concert on Saturday Evening & Services on Sunday. The Sunday Morning Service was a special service for the school's 11 Year Old Children due to transfer to Secondary School. Kneelers embroidered by the children were taken by them for dedication and each child was given a Bible to commemorate their years at Nether Whitacre School. In the school a display of photographs showed life in the village during the century. A Craft Stall, Tombola & other entertainments were provided. On Friday Evening Hot Dogs were served, on Saturday & Sunday Ploughman's Lunches were available and in the afternoon Teas were on sale.
